posts.post_content: this is hard. Sigiled Paladin is a great card especially and he comes out on turn 2. however he's got some tough competition out there. Qasali Pridemage is on hell of a card, him alone can destroy 44 cards in alara reborn alone. SICK. the art of sigiled paladin is awsome.

posts.post_content:
Solid Bant card. Good flavor, matching mechanics, good abilities, the list goes on.  
  
Wish it were ![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol) or ![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) though, seems counter intuitive to be putting down 2 whites in a 3 color deck that early in the game.
posts.html:

Wish it were or though, seems counter intuitive to be putting down 2 whites in a 3 color deck that early in the game.

posts.post_content: Although it is Exalted, this is not a card meant to be used in a Bant deck. Rather, it is a perfect 2 drop for a White Weenie deck. You can get it out second turn and swing for 3 by third turn and even if it's out third turn it'll still boost your other early game cards. I once had three out and swung for 8 in the air with a Baneslayer. Good times.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: An underrated knight. He's above the curve even on his own. In an exalt deck, he'll truly shine. Not the best attacker though. You'll want [Deftblade Elite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deftblade Elite) to annihilate your opponent's creatures and anything with rancor for everything else.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: It's an amazing creature, but doesn't see much play because of all the competition in the 2 cc slot. Qasali Pridemage and Deft Duelist are both more useful in the current removal-heavy environment, Jhessian Infiltrator is unblockable, etc etc.
